kchandra423.kTesting.kAssertions

Class KAssert

  • java.lang.Object
    • kchandra423.kTesting.kAssertions.KAssert

  • public class KAssert
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles basic testing. Can be used to assert the outputs of certain methods, the values of certain fields, or verify the existence of certain methods and constructors within a class

    Note that all values and methods will be looked at regardless of whether they are private

    See Also:
    KAssertionException, KExistenceException

      Constructor and Description
      KAssert()

      • enableSuccessMessages

        public static void enableSuccessMessages(boolean flag)
        Specify whether you would like successful assertions to print to the console
        Parameters:
        flag - True for messages, false for none

      • successMessagesEnabled

        public static boolean successMessagesEnabled()
        Returns whether assertion messages are currently enabled
        Returns:
        Whether assertion messages are enabled

      • kAssertConsoleEquals

        public static void kAssertConsoleEquals(java.lang.String functionName,
                                        java.lang.Object o,
                                        java.lang.String expected,
                                        java.lang.Object... input)
        Asserts that a given object will print the specified output with the specified function name and parameters. Not safe to multi-thread!! Trim set as \n, \t, and spaces
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the method being called on the object. *Case-sensitive!*
        o - The object being used
        expected - The expected value to be printed to the console (or whatever the current system output is)
        input - The parameters being called on the object. *Order matters!*
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the method does not return true
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the method is not found

      • kAssertConsoleEquals

        public static void kAssertConsoleEquals(java.lang.String functionName,
                                        java.lang.Object o,
                                        java.lang.String[] trim,
                                        java.lang.String expected,
                                        java.lang.Object... input)
        Asserts that a given object will print the specified output with the specified function name and parameters. Not safe to multi-thread!!
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the method being called on the object. *Case-sensitive!*
        o - The object being used
        expected - The expected value to be printed to the console (or whatever the current system output is)
        input - The parameters being called on the object. *Order matters!*
        trim - The set of strings that should be trimmed from the console output
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the method does not return true
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the method is not found

      • kAssertConsoleEqualsAny

        public static void kAssertConsoleEqualsAny(java.lang.String functionName,
                                           java.lang.String[] expected,
                                           java.lang.Object o,
                                           java.lang.Object... input)
        Assert that a given object will print to the console the any of the specified outputs when the specified function is called with the given parameters. Trim set for \t, \n, and spaces
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the function being called
        expected - An array of possible outputs
        o - The Object being called
        input - The parameters of the given function/

      • kAssertConsoleEqualsAny

        public static void kAssertConsoleEqualsAny(java.lang.String functionName,
                                           java.lang.String[] trim,
                                           java.lang.String[] expected,
                                           java.lang.Object o,
                                           java.lang.Object... input)
        Assert that a given object will print to the console the any of the specified outputs when the specified function is called with the given parameters. Output is trimmed with the specified trim characters
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the function being called
        expected - An array of possible outputs
        trim - All the strings to be trimmed from the output
        o - The Object being called
        input - The parameters of the given function/

      • kAssertTrue

        public static void kAssertTrue(java.lang.String functionName,
                               java.lang.Object o,
                               java.lang.Object... input)
        Asserts that a given object will return true with the specified function name and parameters.
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the method being called on the object. *Case-sensitive!*
        o - The object being used
        input - The parameters being called on the object. *Order matters!*
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the method does not return true
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the method is not found

      • kAssertEquals

        public static void kAssertEquals(java.lang.String functionName,
                                 java.lang.Object o,
                                 java.lang.Object expected,
                                 java.lang.Object... input)
        Asserts that a given object will return the expected output with the specified function name and parameters.
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the method being called on the object. *Case-sensitive!*
        o - The object being used
        expected - The expected value to be returned
        input - The parameters being called on the object. *Order matters!*
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the method does not return the expected value
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the method is not found

      • kAssertEqualsAny

        public static void kAssertEqualsAny(java.lang.String functionName,
                                    java.lang.Object o,
                                    java.lang.Object[] expectedOutputs,
                                    java.lang.Object... input)
        Asserts that a given object will return the any of the expected values with the specified function name and parameters.
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the method being called on the object. *Case-sensitive!*
        o - The object being used
        expectedOutputs - The values expected to be returned
        input - The parameters being called on the object. *Order matters!*
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the method does not return a value in the expected outputs
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the method is not found

      • kAssertFieldEquals

        public static void kAssertFieldEquals(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                      java.lang.Object o,
                                      java.lang.Object expected)
        Asserts that a given object will have a field with the expected value
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to be looked at
        o - The object being used
        expected - The expected value of the field
        Throws:
        KAssertionException - Throws this exception if the field does not have the expected value
        KExistenceException - Throws this exception if the field is not found
